intro: Eleocharis monandra, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant has thin, grass-like stems that produce small, clustered spikelets at the tips. Its flowers are usually greenish or brownish, and it lacks showy petals, typical of many Cyperaceae species. Eleocharis monandra plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
